channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Government shutdown enters sixth day as both parties appear reluctant to budge
item.description: Senators are reconvening Monday to vote on temporarily funding the government, but both parties seem unlikely to bend in their demands.
item.content:encoded: Senators are reconvening Monday to vote on temporarily funding the government, but both parties seem unlikely to bend in their demands.
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: 'Really, really frustrating': Furloughed federal workers share their stories
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of federal workers have been furloughed because of the government shutdown. NPR's Morning Edition spoke with three of them about their experiences.
item.content:encoded: Hundreds of thousands of federal workers have been furloughed because of the government shutdown. NPR's Morning Edition spoke with three of them about their experiences.
item.dc:creator: Hosts

item.title: Democratic Sen. Chris Van Hollen of Maryland talks about the government shutdown
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Sen. Chris Van Hollen, D-Md., about the government shutdown and the ongoing stalemate between Republicans and Democrats.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Sen. Chris Van Hollen, D-Md., about the government shutdown and the ongoing stalemate between Republicans and Democrats.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: A federal judge blocked the deployment of the National Guard in Oregon, Hamas, Israel and the U.S. will work toward finalizing a peace deal in Egypt Monday, the Supreme Court starts its new term.
item.content:encoded: A federal judge blocked the deployment of the National Guard in Oregon, Hamas, Israel and the U.S. will work toward finalizing a peace deal in Egypt Monday, the Supreme Court starts its new term.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Bari Weiss joins CBS with a mandate for 'balanced and fact-based' news
item.description: CBS' parent company is buying The Free Press and installing Bari Weiss, its contrarian founder, as editor in chief of CBS News.
item.content:encoded:
The Free Press is becoming part of CBS' parent company, Skydance Media.'/>

CBS' parent company is buying The Free Press and installing Bari Weiss, its contrarian founder, as editor in chief of CBS News.

(Image credit: Noam Galai/Getty Images for The Free Press)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Why do women live longer than men? A study offers clues to close the gap
item.description: Women have an evolutionary advantage when it comes to living longer. They outlive men by about five years. This gender gap is true for many mammals, but a new study shows how human males could narrow it.
item.content:encoded:
Women have an evolutionary advantage when it comes to living longer. They outlive men by about five years. This gender gap is true for many mammals, but a new study shows how human males could narrow it.

(Image credit: shapecharge)
item.dc:creator: Allison Aubrey

item.title: Supreme Court term will tackle executive power, executive power and executive power
item.description: The term promises to be hugely consequential and focused in large part on how much power the Constitution gives to the president.
item.content:encoded:
The term promises to be hugely consequential and focused in large part on how much power the Constitution gives to the president.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Palestinian journalist's new book offers a window into the war in Gaza
item.description: Palestinian journalist Plestia Alaqad documented Israel's bombardment of the Gaza Strip after the Hamas Oct. 7 attacks. Her diary is now a book called "The Eyes of Gaza."
item.content:encoded: Palestinian journalist Plestia Alaqad documented Israel's bombardment of the Gaza Strip after the Hamas Oct. 7 attacks. Her diary is now a book called "The Eyes of Gaza."
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Illinois governor calls National Guard deployment an 'invasion' of his state
item.description: Several clashes happened over the weekend between protesters and federal agents in Chicago. It comes as the Trump administration and Illinois Gov. J.B. Pritzker fight over National Guard deployments.
item.content:encoded: Several clashes happened over the weekend between protesters and federal agents in Chicago. It comes as the Trump administration and Illinois Gov. J.B. Pritzker fight over National Guard deployments.
item.dc:creator: Araceli Gomez-Aldana

item.title: 'A cost of climate change': Why the price of electricity is outpacing inflation
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks Robinson Meyer of the climate and energy site Heatmap News why electricity bills are rising faster than inflation.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks Robinson Meyer of the climate and energy site Heatmap News why electricity bills are rising faster than inflation.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep
